AliasOperations.description: Group of all the possible operations related to collection aliases

ChangeAliasesOperation.description: Operation for performing changes of collection aliases. Alias changes are atomic, meaning that no collection modifications can happen between alias operations.

CollectionInfo.description: Current statistics and configuration of the collection

CreateAlias.description: Create alternative name for a collection. Collection will be available under both names for search, retrieve,

CreateCollection.description: Operation for creating new collection and (optionally) specify index params

hnsw_config.description: Custom params for HNSW index. If none - values from service configuration file are used.

optimizers_config.description: Custom params for Optimizers.  If none - values from service configuration file are used.

wal_config.description: Custom params for WAL. If none - values from service configuration file are used.

CreateCollectionOperation.description: Operation for creating new collection and (optionally) specify index params

hnsw_config.description: Custom params for HNSW index. If none - values from service configuration file are used.

optimizers_config.description: Custom params for Optimizers.  If none - values from service configuration file are used.

wal_config.description: Custom params for WAL. If none - values from service configuration file are used.

DeleteCollectionOperation.description: Operation for deleting collection with given name

points.description: Deletes values from each point in this list

Distance.description: Type of internal tags, build from payload Distance function types used to compare vectors

geo_bounding_box.description: Check if points geo location lies in a given area

geo_radius.description: Check if geo point is within a given radius

match.description: Check if point has field with a given value

range.description: Check if points value lies in a given range

should.description: At least one of thous conditions should match

GeoBoundingBox.description:
Geo filter request

Matches coordinates inside the rectangle, described by coordinates of lop-left and bottom-right edges

GeoRadius.description:
Geo filter request

Matches coordinates inside the circle of `radius` and center with coordinates `center`

radius.description: Radius of the area in meters

ef_construct.description: Number of neighbours to consider during the index building. Larger the value - more accurate the search, more time required to build index.

full_scan_threshold.description: Minimal amount of points for additional payload-based indexing. If payload chunk is smaller than `full_scan_threshold` additional indexing won't be used - in this case full-scan search should be preferred by query planner and additional indexing is not required.

m.description: Number of edges per node in the index graph. Larger the value - more accurate the search, more space required.

ef_construct.description: Number of neighbours to consider during the index building. Larger the value - more accurate the search, more time required to build index.

full_scan_threshold.description: Minimal amount of points for additional payload-based indexing. If payload chunk is smaller than `full_scan_threshold` additional indexing won't be used - in this case full-scan search should be preferred by query planner and additional indexing is not required.

m.description: Number of edges per node in the index graph. Larger the value - more accurate the search, more space required.

default_segment_number.description:
Target amount of segments optimizer will try to keep. Real amount of segments may vary depending on multiple parameters: - Amount of stored points - Current write RPS

It is recommended to select default number of segments as a factor of the number of search threads, so that each segment would be handled evenly by one of the threads

deleted_threshold.description: The minimal fraction of deleted vectors in a segment, required to perform segment optimization

indexing_threshold.description: Maximum number of vectors allowed for plain index. Default value based on https://github.com/google-research/google-research/blob/master/scann/docs/algorithms.md

max_optimization_threads.description: Maximum available threads for optimization workers

max_segment_size.description:
Do not create segments larger this number of points. Large segments might require disproportionately long indexation times, therefore it makes sense to limit the size of segments.

If indexation speed have more priority for your - make this parameter lower. If search speed is more important - make this parameter higher.

memmap_threshold.description: Maximum number of vectors to store in-memory per segment. Segments larger than this threshold will be stored as read-only memmaped file.

payload_indexing_threshold.description: Starting from this amount of vectors per-segment the engine will start building index for payload.

vacuum_min_vector_number.description: The minimal number of vectors in a segment, required to perform segment optimization

default_segment_number.description:
Target amount of segments optimizer will try to keep. Real amount of segments may vary depending on multiple parameters: - Amount of stored points - Current write RPS

It is recommended to select default number of segments as a factor of the number of search threads, so that each segment would be handled evenly by one of the threads

deleted_threshold.description: The minimal fraction of deleted vectors in a segment, required to perform segment optimization

indexing_threshold.description: Maximum number of vectors allowed for plain index. Default value based on https://github.com/google-research/google-research/blob/master/scann/docs/algorithms.md

max_optimization_threads.description: Maximum available threads for optimization workers

max_segment_size.description:
Do not create segments larger this number of points. Large segments might require disproportionately long indexation times, therefore it makes sense to limit the size of segments.

If indexation speed have more priority for your - make this parameter lower. If search speed is more important - make this parameter higher.

memmap_threshold.description: Maximum number of vectors to store in-memory per segment. Segments larger than this threshold will be stored as read-only memmaped file.

payload_indexing_threshold.description: Starting from this amount of vectors per-segment the engine will start building index for payload.

vacuum_min_vector_number.description: The minimal number of vectors in a segment, required to perform segment optimization

PayloadInterface.description:
Structure for converting user-provided payload into internal structure representation

Used to allow user provide payload in more human-friendly format, and do not force explicit brackets, included constructions, e.t.c.

Example:

```json {..., "payload": {"city": "Berlin"}, ... } ```

Should be captured by `KeywordShortcut`

PayloadInterfaceStrict.description:
Fallback for `PayloadInterface` which is used if user explicitly specifies type of payload

Example:

```json {..., "payload": {"city": { "type": "keyword", "value": "Berlin" }}, ... } ```

Should be captured by `Keyword(PayloadVariant<String>)`

PayloadOps.description: Define operations description for point payloads manipulation

oneOf.description: Set payload value, overrides if it is already exists
Deletes specified payload values if they are assigned
Drops all Payload values associated with given points.

PayloadSchemaType.description: All possible names of payload types

PayloadSelector.description: Specifies how to treat payload selector

PayloadVariant_for_GeoPoint.description:
Payload interface structure which ensures that user is allowed to pass payload in both - array and single element forms.

Example:

Both versions should work: ```json {..., "payload": {"city": {"type": "keyword", "value": ["Berlin", "London"] }}}, {..., "payload": {"city": {"type": "keyword", "value": "Moscow" }}}, ```

PayloadVariant_for_String.description:
Payload interface structure which ensures that user is allowed to pass payload in both - array and single element forms.

Example:

Both versions should work: ```json {..., "payload": {"city": {"type": "keyword", "value": ["Berlin", "London"] }}}, {..., "payload": {"city": {"type": "keyword", "value": "Moscow" }}}, ```

PayloadVariant_for_double.description:
Payload interface structure which ensures that user is allowed to pass payload in both - array and single element forms.

Example:

Both versions should work: ```json {..., "payload": {"city": {"type": "keyword", "value": ["Berlin", "London"] }}}, {..., "payload": {"city": {"type": "keyword", "value": "Moscow" }}}, ```

PayloadVariant_for_int64.description:
Payload interface structure which ensures that user is allowed to pass payload in both - array and single element forms.

Example:

Both versions should work: ```json {..., "payload": {"city": {"type": "keyword", "value": ["Berlin", "London"] }}}, {..., "payload": {"city": {"type": "keyword", "value": "Moscow" }}}, ```

oneOf.description: Delete points by given filter criteria

RecommendRequest.description:
Recommendation request. Provides positive and negative examples of the vectors, which are already stored in the collection.

Service should look for the points which are closer to positive examples and at the same time further to negative examples. The concrete way of how to compare negative and positive distances is up to implementation in `segment` crate.

filter.description: Look only for points which satisfies this conditions

negative.description: Try to avoid vectors like this

positive.description: Look for vectors closest to those

top.description: Max number of result to return

payload.description: Payload - values assigned to the point

RenameAlias.description: Change alias to a new one

RenameAliasOperation.description: Change alias to a new one

payload.description: Payload - values assigned to the point

score.description: Points vector distance to the query vector

ScrollRequest.description: Scroll request - paginate over all points which matches given condition

filter.description: Look only for points which satisfies this conditions. If not provided - all points.

offset.description: Start ID to read points from. Default: 0

with_payload.description: Return point payload with the result. Default: True

with_vector.description: Return point vector with the result. Default: false

ScrollResult.description: Result of the points read request

next_page_offset.description: Offset which should be used to retrieve a next page result

hnsw_ef.description: Params relevant to HNSW index /// Size of the beam in a beam-search. Larger the value - more accurate the result, more time required for search.

SearchRequest.description: Search request. Holds all conditions and parameters for the search of most similar points by vector similarity given the filtering restrictions.

filter.description: Look only for points which satisfies this conditions

top.description: Max number of result to return

vector.description: Look for vectors closest to this

with_vector.description: Return point vector with the result. Default: false

points.description: Assigns payload to each point in this list

StorageOperations.description: Enumeration of all possible collection update operations

UpdateCollection.description: Operation for updating parameters of the existing collection

optimizers_config.description: Custom params for Optimizers.  If none - values from service configuration file are used. This operation is blocking, it will only proceed ones all current optimizations are complete

UpdateCollectionOperation.description: Operation for updating parameters of the existing collection

optimizers_config.description: Custom params for Optimizers.  If none - values from service configuration file are used. This operation is blocking, it will only proceed ones all current optimizations are complete

wal_capacity_mb.description: Size of a single WAL segment in MB

wal_segments_ahead.description: Number of WAL segments to create ahead of actually used ones

wal_capacity_mb.description: Size of a single WAL segment in MB

wal_segments_ahead.description: Number of WAL segments to create ahead of actually used ones

WithPayloadInterface.description: Options for specifying which payload to include or not
